resources.string: Press the \'%s\' button to scan QR Codes
You\'ll be prompted to grant access to your camera.
You\'ve denied camera permission. This app needs the camera permission to scan QR Codes. Alternatively, you may use \'%s\'.
Point your camera so that the QR Code fits the frame in the center of your phone\'s screen.
Opening photo picker and scanning image for QR Code…
Either the file does not contain any QR Codes, or perhaps the image quality is insufficient.\nPlease try again with another image.
There are no apps on the phone that are able to open the code\'s content.
There are no apps on the phone to share the content.
There was an error trying to save the image, please try again.
Unable to open the link. Make sure you have a browser app (e.g. Chrome) installed.
Input the text in the box below, and the QR Code will automatically be created. Click the image to expand.
An error occurred trying to generate the QR Code, please try again.
Tap your desired format from the list below.\nSome formats follow strict rules - for example only alphanumeric characters or a specific length.

By default, every time you interact with a scanned code (open it in another app, copy it or share it), or a generated code (save it in a file, or copy it or share it), it is saved and can be consulted in this screen.

Your history is local and never leaves your phone.

You can change how your QR Codes are saved in history in the "Settings" tab.
You may remove your history opening an history item and pressing "Remove from history", or long press an history item in the list and select as many as you want to be removed.
You history of scanned and generated codes is empty.
Failed to generate image.\nTry closing the app and opening again.\nIf the issue persists, contact the developer (settings tab).
Are you sure you want to delete this history entry?\n\nThis action is permanent and cannot be reversed.
Are you sure you want to delete all those history entries?\n\nThis action is permanent and cannot be reversed.
Opens the default app browser in the phone (e.g. Chrome).\nThis is the app\'s default option.
Opens the URL in a tab inside the app.\nIf your phone does not support it, it will open it in the browser app.
Via \"Scan\" tab. Whenever you open the QR Code in the app / browser, or copy or share it, it is saved in history.\nYou may also delete your history in History tab at any time.
Your scanned QR Codes and barcodes are never saved in the app.\nExisting history records remain.\nYou may also delete your history in History tab at any time.
Off (default). No vibration when a QR Code / barcode is scanned.
On. Phone will vibrate when a QR Code / barcode is scanned.
Via \"Generate\" tab. Whenever you save a generated QR Code / barcode in a file, or copy or share it, it is saved in history.\nYou may also delete your history in History tab at any time.
Your generated QR Codes and barcodes are never saved in the app.\nExisting history records remain.\nYou may also delete your history in \"History\" tab at any time.
Will open the app\'s Google Play page
Learn more about Mini QR Code app

The Mini QR Code is a free Android app for QR code and barcode scanning and generating.
It has no ads, and no data collection, and will remain like that forever.
The app also doesn't need any internet connection, apart from when opening web pages.

The app is open-source, the source code is publicly available on Github for anyone to see.
The app is worked on by a single developer, but anyone is welcome to contribute via Github, if they wish.

If you have are experiencing issues with the app, or have any suggestions, you may open an issue on Github.
Keep in mind that the Github issue is public, and you should open it in english.

Alternatively, if you do not want to create a Github account or don't want your request to be public, you can contact the developer by e-mail.
Developer speaks fluent English and Portuguese, so please send e-mails in those languages.
